title: Food Hygiene Inspections, Resources and Performance

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I would like to request information relating to food hygiene inspections undertaken by your borough / district.  Kindly provide information or answer questions on the following:
1. What is the total number of food businesses which are currently awaiting a hygiene inspection for unrated premises in your district or borough?
2. What is the number of food inspectors who undertake site inspections three days a week or more within your service?
3. What is the total number of food establishments on your Register?
4. What is the number of overdue inspections (with reference to the Food Law Code of Practice) broken down into risk categories A to E?
5. What are the number of inspections (all categories) overdue by time periods:
a) 6 months
b) 1 year
c) 2 years
d) 5 years
e) more than 5 years
6. The number of food inspectors you have who work three days a week or more after 5pm or at weekends undertaking food hygiene inspection?
7. Your recovery plan to comply with the Food Law Code of Practice to meet your legal obligations on inspection frequencies if you have any overdue inspections?
Yours faithfully,
Sebastian McCormick

Dear Sebastian McCormick,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Food Hygiene
Inspections, Resources and Performance which we received on 04/11/2023.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 04/12/2023. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Sebastian McCormick,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Food Hygiene
Inspections, Resources and Performance which we received on 04/11/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. What is the total number of food businesses which are currently
awaiting a hygiene inspection for unrated premises in your district or
borough?
Total = 580
2. What is the number of food inspectors who undertake site inspections
three days a week or more within your service?
10
3. What is the total number of food establishments on your Register?
Total = 5204
4. What is the number of overdue inspections (with reference to the Food
Law Code of Practice) broken down into risk categories A to E?
A = 0
B = 13
C = 262
D = 819
E = 524
5. What are the number of inspections (all categories) overdue by time
periods:
a) 6 months
Total = 695
b) 1 year
Total = 498
c) 2 years
Total = 914
d) 5 years
Total = 87
e) more than 5 years
Total = 3
6. The number of food inspectors you have who work three days a week or
more after 5pm or at weekends undertaking food hygiene inspection?
All of the above 10 Officers do undertake some out of hours work including
evenings and weekends
7. Your recovery plan to comply with the Food Law Code of Practice to meet
your legal obligations on inspection frequencies if you have any overdue
inspections?
The FSA recovery period has now ended and the FSA expect all local
authorities to align their inspection plans in accordance with the Food
Law Code of Practice.  Sheffield has a food plan which has been presented
to Senior Directors and Cabinet Members for official sign off.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains

licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”

If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
